items.title: Japan gets its first female prime minister, ending three-month political vacuum
items.standfirst: Japan's parliament has voted to elect the country's first woman prime minister. Ultraconservative San-eye Taka-ichi is among Japanese politicians who have stonewalled measures for women‚Äôs advancement. She supports the imperial family‚Äôs male-only succession and opposes same-sex marriage and allowing separate surnames for married couples.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei 225 erases gains after hitting record highs as Takaichi becomes prime minister
items.standfirst: Japan's benchmark Nikkei 225 erased its gains Tuesday, falling from record highs, after hardline conservative Sanae Takaichi won the lower house vote, to become Japan's first woman prime minister. She received 237 votes, clinching the majority of the 465-seat chamber, according to public‚Ä¶

items.title: Sanae Takaichi on course to become Japan‚Äôs first female PM after new coalition deal
items.standfirst: Officials confirm reports that Takaichi‚Äôs Liberal Democratic party will join forces with rightwing Nippon IshinSanae Takaichi is on course to become Japan‚Äôs first female prime minister this week after her party agreed to form a new coalition with a minor party.Officials confirmed on Monday that Takaichi‚Äôs Liberal Democratic party (LDP) had joined forces with the rightwing Nippon Ishin (Japan Innovation party), which shares her hawkish stance on China and support for restrictions on immigration. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials confirm reports that Takaichi‚Äôs Liberal Democratic party will join forces with rightwing Nippon IshinSanae Takaichi is on course to become Japan‚Äôs first female prime minister this week after her party agreed to form a new coalition with a minor party.Officials confirmed on Monday that Takaichi‚Äôs Liberal Democratic party (LDP) had joined forces with the rightwing Nippon Ishin (Japan Innovation party), which shares her hawkish stance on China and support for restrictions on immigration. ai_summary: Sanae Takaichi, an ultraconservative, was elected as Japan's first female prime minister.
She is taking office amid rising living costs and significant national debt.
Takaichi supports the imperial family's male-only succession.
She opposes same-sex marriage and separate surnames for married couples.
Some analysts predict potential shifts in defense spending and tax policies.

items.title: 'Unprecedented': Sarkozy imprisonment sets powerful 'precedent on need for probity in public office'
items.standfirst: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy arrived at the gates of the notorious La Sant√© prison where he will now serve his 5-year sentence for a criminal conspiracy to finance his 2007 election campaign with funds from Libya. He is the first post-WWII leader of France to be imprisoned. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective on this unprecedented moment in French history, Stuart Norval is joined by fellow journalists Clovis Casali, Philip Turle and Ellen Gainsford, and expert analysis of our guest Dr. Andrew Smith, historian of modern France and Lecturer in Liberal Arts at Queen Mary University of London.
items.content: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy arrived at the gates of the notorious La Sant√© prison where he will now serve his 5-year sentence for a criminal conspiracy to finance his 2007 election campaign with funds from Libya. He is the first post-WWII leader of France to be imprisoned. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective on this unprecedented moment in French history, Stuart Norval is joined by fellow journalists Clovis Casali, Philip Turle and Ellen Gainsford, and expert analysis of our guest Dr. Andrew Smith, historian of modern France and Lecturer in Liberal Arts at Queen Mary University of London.

items.title: Nicolas Sarkozy serving prison sentence is 'completely unprecedented'
items.standfirst: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has gone to the Paris prison where he will be serving a 5-year prison sentence. He was found guilty of seeking to acquire funding from Muammar Kadhafi's Libya for the campaign that saw him elected. He is only the third French leader in History to go to prison, and the first since World War 2. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks into what makes this decision historic.
items.content: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has gone to the Paris prison where he will be serving a 5-year prison sentence. He was found guilty of seeking to acquire funding from Muammar Kadhafi's Libya for the campaign that saw him elected. He is only the third French leader in History to go to prison, and the first since World War 2. FRANCE 24's Philip Turle looks into what makes this decision historic.

items.title: Nicolas Sarkozy enters prison to begin five-year sentence over criminal conspiracy
items.standfirst: Former president organised stage-managed departure from his Paris home before becaming first French postwar leader to be jailedEurope live ‚Äì latest updatesThe former French president Nicolas Sarkozy has entered a prison in Paris, after a court sentenced him to five years for criminal conspiracy over a scheme to obtain election campaign funds from the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.France‚Äôs rightwing president between 2007 and 2012 is the first former head of an EU country to serve time in prison, and the first French postwar leader to be jailed. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president organised stage-managed departure from his Paris home before becaming first French postwar leader to be jailedEurope live ‚Äì latest updatesThe former French president Nicolas Sarkozy has entered a prison in Paris, after a court sentenced him to five years for criminal conspiracy over a scheme to obtain election campaign funds from the regime of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi.France‚Äôs rightwing president between 2007 and 2012 is the first former head of an EU country to serve time in prison, and the first French postwar leader to be jailed. Continue reading...

items.title: Political pressure expected to increase on Nicolas Sarkozy case as parole request lodged
items.standfirst: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy starts serving his 5-year sentence today October 21, 2025. As his legal team says the appeal's court will decide on his parole within a month, political pressure is expected to increase. FRANCE 24's Marc Perelman analyses why the former president was served a prison sentence and the political dynamics at play.
items.content: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy starts serving his 5-year sentence today October 21, 2025. As his legal team says the appeal's court will decide on his parole within a month, political pressure is expected to increase. FRANCE 24's Marc Perelman analyses why the former president was served a prison sentence and the political dynamics at play.

items.title: Former French President arrives at Paris prison to serve sentence

Crowds have gathered to support him in front of the building. The crowd gathered in front of his home at the call of his son, Louis Sarkozy. FRANCE 24's Ellen Gainsford comments from the scene.

items.standfirst: A major outage at the Amazon Web Services (AWS) on Monday disrupted a large portion of the internet, taking down apps, websites and online tools used by millions of people around the world, before services were eventually restored. The hours-long breakdown of the cloud system that supports a‚Ä¶

The hours-long breakdown of the cloud system that supports a‚Ä¶

items.title: Amazon Web Services outage finally resolved
items.standfirst: An Amazon Web Services outage impacting Amazon's own services and as well as apps around the world wasn't resolved until Monday evening.`
items.content: An Amazon Web Services outage impacting Amazon's own services and as well as apps around the world wasn't resolved until Monday evening.`

items.title: What caused Amazon‚Äôs AWS outage, and why did so many major apps go offline?
items.standfirst: Amazon Web Services, a cloud platform that supports a portion of the internet, experienced a massive outage on Monday.
items.content: Amazon Web Services, a cloud platform that supports a portion of the internet, experienced a massive outage on Monday.

items.title: What the Huge AWS Outage Reveals About the Internet
items.standfirst: Amazon Web Services experienced DNS resolution issues on Monday morning, taking down wide swaths of the web‚Äîand highlighting a long-standing weakness in the internet's infrastructure.
items.content: Amazon Web Services experienced DNS resolution issues on Monday morning, taking down wide swaths of the web‚Äîand highlighting a long-standing weakness in the internet's infrastructure.

items.title: Amazon Says All Cloud Services Restored After 15-Hour Outage
items.standfirst: Amazon Web Services, the world‚Äôs largest cloud provider, resolved the issues that plagued its services for about 15 hours on Monday, an episode that highlighted how much of the internet is dependent on the operations of a single company.
items.content: Amazon Web Services, the world‚Äôs largest cloud provider, resolved the issues that plagued its services for about 15 hours on Monday, an episode that highlighted how much of the internet is dependent on the operations of a single company.

ai_summary: A major Amazon Web Services (AWS) outage occurred on Monday.
The outage took down numerous apps, websites, and online tools.
The outage lasted for approximately 15 hours before being resolved.
The incident highlighted the internet's dependence on a single company.
The outage caused DNS resolution issues, impacting internet infrastructure.

clusters.title: Hazardous smog blankets New Delhi after Diwali fireworks
clusters.neutral_headline: Delhi Suffers Hazardous Smog After Diwali Fireworks

items.title: Hazardous smog blankets New Delhi after Diwali fireworks
items.standfirst: Millions of Indians celebrated Diwali on October 20, 2025, as the country marked the Hindu festival symbolising the victory of light over darkness. People ate festive meals, exchanged gifts and set off colourful fireworks across the country. But in a country that already has very high levels of air pollution, the fireworks can add to the toxic smog.
items.content: Millions of Indians celebrated Diwali on October 20, 2025, as the country marked the Hindu festival symbolising the victory of light over darkness. People ate festive meals, exchanged gifts and set off colourful fireworks across the country. But in a country that already has very high levels of air pollution, the fireworks can add to the toxic smog.

items.title: Possibility of Trump-Putin summit in Hungary raises concerns among EU leaders
items.standfirst: Some EU leaders are raising concerns about the possibility of a summit between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin in Budapest, as the Russian president is wanted by the International Criminal Court for war crimes. Many are uneasy about the prospect of him visiting the bloc‚Äôs territory. Meanwhile Ukraine‚Äôs Volodymyr Zelensky says he‚Äôs willing to also attend the summit and will do so if he‚Äôs invited.
